chat.woot.intern.noedit: Player is not allowed to edit

gui.woot.anvil.name: Stygian Anvil
gui.woot.enchsqueezer.name: Enchant Liquifier
gui.woot.fluidconvertor.name: Fluid Vat

guide.woot.basics.conatus.0: The factory is fueled by Conatus Fluid which is stored in the $(item)Conatus Cell$(0) at the base of the factory. This can be created in the $(item)Fluid Vat$(0) from a variety of different sources.
guide.woot.basics.conatus.name: Conatus Fluid
guide.woot.basics.credits.0: Some appreciation for others in the Minecraft modding community. I don't interact with other modders, however their mod sources and tools have been a great help while developing Woot - they make not all like this mod, but I appreciate their contributions to the Minecraft modding scene.
guide.woot.basics.credits.1: $(li)The Forge developers$(li)Vazkii - for Patchouli$(li)McJty - for his modding tutorials$(li)The Forge Forum members that help with my questions.
guide.woot.basics.credits.name: Credits
guide.woot.basics.ingredients.0: Some mobs require ingredients to drop their loot and these must be provided in chests/tanks beside the $(item)Ingredient Importer$(0).ALL ingredients for ALL mobs be provided or no loot will be produced.
guide.woot.basics.ingredients.name: Ingredients
guide.woot.basics.intro.0: Woot provides a solution to the ago old Minecraft problem of - $(#f00)I WANT ALL THE MOB DROPS!.$() The traditional solution is to spawn mobs as quickly as possible, kill them automatically and then pick up all the drops that they leave behind.
guide.woot.basics.intro.1: There are many interesting ways to perform this operation. The main drawback is that there are lots of entities generated and when scaled up on a server can impact performance. Woot gives you a mob farm/factory without generating all those messy entities and hopefully takes a bit of load off your server. It is also for lazy people like me that don't like building mob farms.
guide.woot.basics.intro.name: What is this mod for?
guide.woot.basics.mobshard.0: A $(item)Mob Shard$(0) is used to capture a mob to use in the factory. First you must create the $(item)Mob Shard$(0) then attack a mob to program that shard. With the shard in your inventory you must kill a certain number of that mob. When the kill count is reached the shard will be programmed and can then be converted into a $(l:mobs/controller)Mob Controller.
guide.woot.basics.mobshard.name: Capturing mobs
guide.woot.basics.stygianiron.0: The main resource in Woot is $(item)Stygian Iron$(0). You will need this to create the machines, tools and factory components
guide.woot.basics.stygianiron.name: Stygian Iron
guide.woot.basics.tiers.0: The factory comes in various tiers, with higher tiers support higher value mobs and higher level perks. Each factory tier builds upon the structure of the previous tier. Lower value mobs can be used in higher tier factories. You use Scale The Summit perk to get higher tier shards.
guide.woot.basics.tiers.1: Every factory requires the following$(br2)$(li)1xHeart$(li)1xPrimary Base$(li)1xConatus Cell$(li)1xIngredient Importer$(li)1xLoot Exporter
guide.woot.basics.tiers.10: $(l)Magister [V]$()$(br2)This tier is normally used for bosses such as the Ender Dragon. It is the only tier that can use exotics.$(br2)Supports the following:$(br)$(li)4xMob Controller$(li)4xPerk III$(li)1xExotic$(br2)
guide.woot.basics.tiers.12: Each tier has a maximum mob health that can be handled. The following pages show the default maximum health and any exceptions to the rules (cough, cough, Endermen)
guide.woot.basics.tiers.name: Factory tiers
guide.woot.basics.tldr.0: $(li)$(item)Layout Guide$(0) shows you the factory layout and can step through each y-level$(li)$(item)Layout Guide$(0) and $(item)Factory Heart$(0) are directional$(li)Use $(item)The Intern$(0) on the $(item)Factory Heart$(0) to autobuild$(li)Factory needs Conatus Fluid to run, but no power
guide.woot.basics.tldr.1: $(li)Some mobs need ingredients to generate loot$(li)$(item)The Intern$(0) can also validate your factory structure$(li)Mobs have a minimum tier of factory to spawn$(li)Must apply all the previous tiers of a perk to use higher tier ones$(li)Place chests beside the $(item)Loot Exporter$(0)$(li)Scale The Summit perk generates shards for higher tier blocks
guide.woot.basics.tldr.name: TLDR
guide.woot.category.basics.desc: How to build and run your mob factory.
guide.woot.category.factoryBlocks.desc: The blocks that make up the factor.
guide.woot.category.machines.desc: Important machines for creating and running your Woot factory.
guide.woot.category.perks.desc: How to make your factory better.
guide.woot.category.tools.desc: The tools of Woot. (Yes, another mod with a hammer.)
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_a.0: This exotic reduces the amount of fluid recipe ingredients required by 85.0%%.
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_a.name: Enochian Key: LIL
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_b.0: This exotic reduces the amount of item recipe ingredients required by 85.0%%.
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_b.name: Enochian Key: ARN
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_c.0: This exotic reduces the amount of Conatus fluid required by 85.0%%.
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_c.name: Enochian Key: ZOM
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_d.0: This exotic runs the factory at a fixed spawn time of 20 ticks.
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_d.name: Enochian Key: PAZ
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_e.0: This exotic spawns 10 mobs for each controller.
guide.woot.exotics.exotic_e.name: Enochian Key: LAT
guide.woot.exotics.intro.0: Exotics give an extra boost to the factory by providing something in excess of perk abilities. Only one can be applied to a factory and it must be placed on top of the $(item)Heart$(0).
guide.woot.exotics.intro.1: Exotics can only be applied to Tier V factories. They cannot be crafted and are very rare drops from End City treasure chests.
guide.woot.exotics.intro.name: What are exotics for?
guide.woot.factory_blocks.cap_a.name: Theoricus Cap
guide.woot.factory_blocks.cap_b.name: Practicus Cap
guide.woot.factory_blocks.cap_c.name: Exemptus Cap
guide.woot.factory_blocks.cap_d.name: Magister Cap
guide.woot.factory_blocks.cells.0: There are four types of $(item)Conatus Cell$(0). Each is compatible with all factories tiers. The only differences are the amount of fluid they can hold and the transfer rate. Fluids can be inserted or removed from any side.
guide.woot.factory_blocks.cells.name: Conatus Cells
guide.woot.factory_blocks.controller.0: The $(item)Mob Controller$(0) tells the factory which mob you would like to spawn. However not all factories are created equal. Each $(item)Mob Controller$(0) requires a minimum tier of factory to use. The tier can be seen by right clicking on a $(item)Mob Controller$(0)
guide.woot.factory_blocks.controller.1: The $(item)Mob Controller$(0) is created on the $(item)Stygian Anvil$(0) by combining a fully programmed $(item)Mob Shard$(0) with a $(item)Prism$(0) and $(item)Stygian Iron Plate$(0).
guide.woot.factory_blocks.exporter.0: This block is used by the factory for generating the loot drops. A chest or tank must be adjacent to any side of this block. If there is no space in the attached blocks, then the items will not be generated.
guide.woot.factory_blocks.exporter.name: Loot Exporter
guide.woot.factory_blocks.factory_a.name: Amaranth Block
guide.woot.factory_blocks.factory_b.name: Amber Block
guide.woot.factory_blocks.factory_c.name: Celadon Block
guide.woot.factory_blocks.factory_d.name: Cerulean Block
guide.woot.factory_blocks.factory_e.name: Byzantium Block
guide.woot.factory_blocks.importer.0: This block is used by the factory for importing ingredients that are required to spawn the mob. A chest or tank must be adjacent to any side of this block and contain the specified ingredients to complete the spawn process and generate loot.
guide.woot.factory_blocks.importer.name: Ingredient Importer
guide.woot.factory_blocks.perkslot.0: Perks are applied to the $(item)Perk Slot$(0). A $(item)Perk Slot$(0) can accept a single type of perk. An empty $(item)Perk Slot$(0) can take any level I perk. All previous levels of perk must be applied before the next level is accepted. Different tiers of factory have a maximum level of perk that they will work with.
guide.woot.factory_blocks.perkslot.1: Higher tier perks can be applied to lower tier factories, however the factory will ignore any perk benefits over its level capacity.
guide.woot.factory_blocks.perkslot.name: Perk Slot
guide.woot.factory_blocks.pri_base.0: A valid $(item)Mob Controller$(0) $(#f00)must$() be placed on this block for the factory to form.
guide.woot.factory_blocks.pri_base.name: Primary Controller Base
guide.woot.factory_blocks.sec_base.0: A valid $(item)Mob Controller$(0) may be placed on this block.
guide.woot.factory_blocks.sec_base.name: Secondary Controller Base
guide.woot.machines.dyesqueezer.0: The $(item)Dye Liquifier$(0) takes dye items, or items that can creates dyes and converts them into red, yellow, blue and white fluids. These are then combined into Pure Dye which can be used to create dye casings or any color in the $(item)Injection Press$(0).
guide.woot.machines.dyesqueezer.1: Items can be inserted from any side. Pure Dye can be extracted from any side. The $(item)Dye Liquifier$(0) will automatically output to an adjacent fluid handler.
guide.woot.machines.dyesqueezer.name: Dye Liquifier
guide.woot.machines.enchsqueezer.0: The $(item)Enchant Liquifier$(0) takes enchanted items (books, swords etc), extracts the enchantments from them and creates Liquid Enchant fluid. Higher level enchants create more fluid.
guide.woot.machines.enchsqueezer.1: Items can be inserted from any side. Liquid Enchant can be extracted from any side.  The $(item)Enchant Liquifier$(0) will automatically output to an adjacent fluid handler.
guide.woot.machines.enchsqueezer.2: $(li) Enchant I 500mb $(li) Enchant II 1000mb $(li) Enchant III 1500mb $(li) Enchant IV 2000mb $(li) Enchant V 2500mb $(li) Each extra level 500mb
guide.woot.machines.enchsqueezer.name: Enchant Liquifier
guide.woot.machines.fluidconvertor.0: The Woot factory runs on Conatus Fluid, which is primarily generated with the $(item)Fluid Vat$(0). The machine takes a fluid and a catalyst, then converts that into Conatus Fluid. Different fluid/catalyst combinations give differing amounts on Conatus Fluid.
guide.woot.machines.fluidconvertor.1: Items can be inserted from any side. Input fluids can be inserted from the left, top or front. Output fluids can be removed from the bottom, back and right sides.
guide.woot.machines.fluidconvertor.name: Fluid Vat
guide.woot.machines.infuser.0: $(item)The Injection Press$(0) injects fluids into items. It can be used with Pure Dye to create Dye Plates. It can be used with Liquid Enchant to create factory upgrade plates and enchanted books.
guide.woot.machines.infuser.1: Items can be inserted from the top, left and front sides. Output items can be removed from the bottom, right and back sides. Fluids can be inserted via any side.
guide.woot.machines.infuser.name: Injection Press
guide.woot.perks.crusher.0: This perk generates Industrial Foregoing essence in tanks adjacent to the Loot Exporter. Higher levels of this perk will increase the generated amount of fluid.
guide.woot.perks.crusher.name: Pressing Engagement
guide.woot.perks.efficiency.0: This perk decreases the amount of Conatus Fluid required by the factory. Higher levels of this perk will decrease the fluid requirement further.
guide.woot.perks.efficiency.1: $(li)Tier I - 15%% decrease$(li)Tier II - 25%% decrease$(li)Tier III - 30%% decrease
guide.woot.perks.efficiency.name: Stoke The Boiler
guide.woot.perks.flayed.0: This perk allows mobs being processed by the Woot factory to be used by the Martyr ritual to generate LP. Higher levels of this perk will increase the mob health available to the ritual.
guide.woot.perks.flayed.name: Flayed
guide.woot.perks.headless.0: The $(item)Head Start$(0) perk drops skulls. Higher levels of this perk give a better chance of the drop.
guide.woot.perks.headless.1: $(li)Tier I - 25%% chance$(li)Tier II - 50%% chance$(li)Tier III - 80%% chance
guide.woot.perks.headless.name: Head Start
guide.woot.perks.laser.0: This perk generates Industrial Foregoing ether gas in tanks adjacent to the Loot Exporter. Higher levels of this perk will increase the generated amount of the gas.As per the original mod, only generates from Withers
guide.woot.perks.laser.name: Frickin Laser Breams
guide.woot.perks.looting.0: The $(item)Treasure Island$(0) perk sets the looting level that the factory will use. The looting levels vary from Looting I to Looting III.
guide.woot.perks.looting.name: Treasure Island
guide.woot.perks.mass.0: The $(item)Rampage$(0) perk increases the number of mobs spawned by the factory. Higher levels of this perk will spawn more mobs. When a factory contains multiple mobs, then the mob with the smallest mass number will be used.
guide.woot.perks.mass.1: $(li)Tier I - 2 mobs$(li)Tier II - 4 mobs$(li)Tier III - 6 mobs
guide.woot.perks.mass.name: Rampage
guide.woot.perks.rate.0: The $(item)Feeding Frenzy$(0) perk decreases the time to generate the mobs. Higher levels of this perk will decrease the time further. When a factory contains multiple mobs, then the mob with the smallest rate reduction will be used.
guide.woot.perks.rate.1: $(li)Tier I - 20%% decrease$(li)Tier II - 50%% decrease$(li)Tier III - 75%% decrease
guide.woot.perks.rate.name: Feeding Frenzy
guide.woot.perks.slaughter.0: This perk generates Industrial Foregoing pink slime and liquid meat in tanks adjacent to the Loot Exporter. Higher levels of this perk will increase the generated amount of the fluids.
guide.woot.perks.slaughter.name: Tumbling Doll Of Flesh
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.0: To create higher tier versions of the Woot factory you need to use essence to create the blocks. These essence are generated by the factory when this perk is installed. Each level of this perk defines a number of rolls for the essence generation and a drop chance for each of the essence types. The factory tier determines what the chances are to drop each essence type.
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.1: $(li)Tier I - 1 chances to drop essence$(li)Tier II - 2 chances to drop essence$(li)Tier III - 3 chances to drop essence
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.2: A Tier I Factory has a 5.0%% chance to drop a shard.$(li)Celadon - weight 80$(li)Cerulean - weight 20$(li)Byzantium - weight 1
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.3: A Tier II Factory has a 10.0%% chance to drop a shard.$(li)Celadon - weight 70$(li)Cerulean - weight 25$(li)Byzantium - weight 4
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.4: A Tier III Factory has a 20.0%% chance to drop a shard.$(li)Celadon - weight 60$(li)Cerulean - weight 30$(li)Byzantium - weight 8
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.5: A Tier IV Factory has a 30.0%% chance to drop a shard.$(li)Celadon - weight 50$(li)Cerulean - weight 40$(li)Byzantium - weight 12
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.6: A Tier V Factory has a 40.0%% chance to drop a shard.$(li)Celadon - weight 40$(li)Cerulean - weight 50$(li)Byzantium - weight 16
guide.woot.perks.tier_shard.name: Scale The Summit
guide.woot.perks.xp.0: By default the factory does not generate experience from mob kills. With the $(item)Wisdom$(0) perk, the factory will generate $(item)Experience Shards$(0) and $(item)Experience Splinters$(0). Higher levels of this perk will generate more experience items.
guide.woot.perks.xp.name: Wisdom
guide.woot.tools.hammer.0: The $(item)YA Hammer$(0) has two main usages. The first is for crafting on the anvil. The second is for use in vanilla crafting. The $(item)YA Hammer$(0) is never consumed when used in recipes.
guide.woot.tools.hammer.name: YA Hammer
guide.woot.tools.intern.0: $(item)The Intern$(0) is there to replace that tedious task of manually building and upgrading the factory structure. Not only can it build but also, with no extra payment, validate an existing structure.
guide.woot.tools.intern.1: When in one of the build modes, $(item)The Intern$(0) will take the factory blocks from your inventory and place them into the world. The tier of factory built will depend on the mode that $(item)The Intern$(0) is in.
guide.woot.tools.intern.2: $(li)The tool should be used on a pre-placed Heart.$(li)The current mode can be cycled by left-clicking in the air.
guide.woot.tools.intern.craft.0: Why bark when you have a dog.
guide.woot.tools.intern.name: The Intern
guide.woot.tools.layout.0: The $(item)Layout Guide$(0) will show you where the blocks need to be placed for a factory. It can be placed on top of an existing Factory Heart or on its own.
guide.woot.tools.layout.1: $(li)Right clicking will step through the different tiers$(li)Sneak right click will step through the y-levels of the current tier
guide.woot.tools.layout.name: Layout Guide
guide.woot.tools.oracle.0: $(item)Dee's Oracle$(0) allows you to view any simulated mob, the associated drops and drop chance at each looting level.
guide.woot.tools.oracle.name: Dee's Oracle
info.woot.exotic.0: Drops from End City loot chests
info.woot.exotic.exotic_c: Increase efficiency of Conatus usage to %0.2f%%
info.woot.intern: Use on the factory heart to form, build or validate a factory
info.woot.mobshard.0: Attack mob with shard to capture
info.woot.mobshard.1: Kill mobs to fill the shard
info.woot.mobshard.2: Shard must be in your hotbar to fill
info.woot.mobshard.3: Can be cleared in a crafting table
info.woot.perk.flayed: Allows mobs to be subjected to the Ritual Of The Martyr
info.woot.perk.laser: Generate industrial foregoing ether gas from Withers
info.woot.perk.slaughter: Generate Industrial Foregoing pink slime and liquid meat
info.woot.perk.tier_shard: Generate essence to upgrade the factory
info.woot.shard.1: Sneak right click to consume full stack
info.woot.squeezer.glow: Use glowstone on machine to swap dump/strict mode
item.woot.guide.landing: A guide to the big, bad, magic multiblock Mob Factory. Like Marmite, you will either love it or hate it - you choose.
item.woot.guide.name: Woot Guide
item.woot.slaughter_1: Tumbling Doll Of Flesh I Perk
item.woot.slaughter_2: Tumbling Doll Of Flesh II Perk
item.woot.slaughter_3: Tumbling Doll Of Flesh III Perk
jei.woot.anvil.1: Must be placed on a Magma block.
jei.woot.anvil.2: Items are right-clicked onto the top of the anvil to place them.
jei.woot.anvil.3: Use the YA Hammer to craft.
jei.woot.intern.0: Can be used to auto-build or validate the factory.
jei.woot.intern.1: Use on a factory heart to build or validate.
jei.woot.mob_shard.0: Hit a mob with the shard to program.
jei.woot.mob_shard.1: A number of mobs of that type must then be killed with the shard in your inventory to fully program it.
jei.woot.mob_shard.2: Once fully programmed it can be turned into a controller on the anvil.
jei.woot.puredye: Generated by the Dye Liquifier from 72mb blue, 72mb white, 72mb red and 72mb yellow
jei.woot.shard: Generated from the factory with the Scale The Summit perk installed.
(Altar) This range defines the area which the ritual will search for the blood altar.
(Heart) This range defines the area which the ritual will search for a Woot factory heart.
ritual.woot.ritualInfernalMachine.info: Uses a Woot factory within the heart zone to provide mod damage to a nearby blood altar.
top.woot.controller.mob.label: Mob
top.woot.controller.tier.label: Required Tier
top.woot.heart.exotic.label: Exotic
top.woot.heart.mob.label: Mob
top.woot.heart.perk.label: Perk
top.woot.heart.progress.label: Progress
